0.commit_message: docs: Add warning in authentication section, and move the section later (Bug 1496658) r=glob

1.commit_message:
vcsreplicator: create a `repofilter` decorator and apply to message handlers (Bug 1491373) r=gps

This commit creates a repository filtering decorator which wraps
the message handler function to check if a message corresponds
to a repo which is being filtered out on this instance. A
decorator is used to separate the filtering logic out from the
message handler logic, while allowing the filter logic to be defined
in a single place.

To test this functionality, we create a new `filteredconsumer` which
has a set of replication rules defined in it's configuration file.
We also add some output to `test-corrupt-repo-replication.t` to
account for the extra layer on the failure stack trace created by
the `repofilter` wrapper.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6917

2.commit_message:
vcsreplicator: apply repo filtering to hgweb bootstrap procedure (Bug 1491373) r=gps

This commit makes the bootstrap procedure respect the
repo filtering rules set in the hgweb replicator config
file. The hgweb procedure receives the input object
from the hgssh procedure and applies the aggregate filter
function to the set of repos specified in the hgweb config
file. Then the process continues as normal, except when a
message is being processed for a repo which has been removed
from the set of repos to replicate, it is ignored and the
process continues. Immediately after removing filtered repos
from the set of repos to be replicated, we also log which
repos were filtered out and specify the offending rule for
debugging purposes.

There are a few advantages to this implementation. The hgssh
step is unaware of the filtering rules applied to the individual
hgweb instances. This means we could set up separate instances
to be dedicated to different repositories in the future and
bootstrap all of them with the result of a single hgssh bootstrap
run. We also keep the hgssh and hgweb roles separate in terms of
shared data since we won't need to pass the hgweb replication config
to the hgssh instances for filtering.

A disadvantage to this approach is that we will spend some time
collecting and acknowledging Kafka messages for repos we wish to
replicate. If we did pass hgweb filter rules to the hgssh instance,
we could avoid aggregating the messages altogether and only produce
bootstrap messages for repos we wish to replicate. This would have
a disadvantage in being need to run multiple times if we wish
to bootstrap multiple hgweb heads with different replication rules
at the same time.

To test this feature, we add a `set-config-option` file to the
Ansible docker-hgweb role, which is essentially the same as
docker-hgssh's `set-hgrc-option`, except it takes a full path
to the file and acts on any valid `.ini` file.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6916

3.commit_message:
vcsreplicator: add a `filter` function to the `Config` class (Bug 1491373) r=gps

This commit adds a function which applies filter rules to a given
repo name (assumed to be in wire path format) and returns a
`RepoFilterResult` with a yes/no boolean indicating if the
repo should be filtered or not, and a string name value
which is the alias of the rule which did/did not filter
the repo. The rules are applied in the following order

    0. If there are no filters defined, pass.
    1. If repo is explicitly included, pass.
    2. If repo is explicitly excluded, fail.
    3. If repo matches an include regex and
       does not match an exclude regex, pass.
    4. Catch-all fail.

Using this order will allow us to set general pattern
matching rules to include/exclude repos, but also bypass
those rules for specific repositories as we deem necessary.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6914

4.commit_message:
vcsreplicator: add logic to parse `replicationrules` config section (Bug 1491373) r=gps

This commit adds logic to the `config.Config` constructor for
parsing a config section with rules for filtering repositories
out of the set of repositories to replicate. The section must
be named `replicationrules` and each entry takes the form
`behaviour.name = syntax:rule`. "Behaviour" is one of
{include, exclude}, indicating if the rule will force inclusion
or exclusion of any matching repos. "Name" is an alias given
to the rule, which will be used for debugging and logging
during filtering (something like "repo X filtered by rule Y").
"Syntax" is the type of rule the "rule" string will be applied
to. The current available "syntax" values are "re" for regular
expression and "path" for explicit (ie explicitly include repo X).
An example section would look like:

    [replicationrules]
    exclude.user = re:\{moz\}/user.*
    include.releases = re:\{moz\}/releases/.*
    include.myuserrepo = path:{moz}/users/cosheehan_mozilla.com/vct
    exclude.beta = path:{moz}/releases/mozilla-beta

Follow up commits will specify the ordering of rule checking and
how the replication processes will use these filters.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6913

5.commit_message:
hghooks: update Zibi Braniecki's reviewer token to Phabricator username (Bug 1496087) r=gps

Zibi's MozReview username was "gandalf", but he switched to
"zbraniecki" when registering for Phabricator. The hook will
fail despite his r+ review due to looking for the old username.
This commit updates the username to reflect the change.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D7624

6.commit_message: docs: fix some typos in extensions.rst

7.commit_message: testing: install Mercurial 4.7.2 in test environment

8.commit_message:
ansible/hg-ssh: tweak pushdataaggregator service restart settings (bug 1492116); r=sheehan

Currently, the service is hitting its burst start limits apparently
due to Kafka intermittently being in a bad state. The service is put
in a failed state and stops restarting.

This patch does 2 things to mitigate:

1) Increases the sleep between restarts from 100ms to 3. If Kafka is
   in a bad state, this will give Kafka more time to recover and
   increase the chances of the restart "sticking."

2) Raises the start limit limits. We now allow up to 20 failures in a
   300s period before the start limiting kicks in. Combined with a 3s
   restart backoff, systemd will attempt restarts for at least 60s
   after initial failure before giving up. This seems like a reasonable
   amount of time to retry before giving up.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6818

9.commit_message:
pushlog: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1485878) r=gps

The final failing test for pushlog was failing due to a dependency
on the `hgmo` extension. Now that `hgmo` is compatible with 4.7,
we can mark this extension compatible as well.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6740

10.commit_message:
hgmo: mark as compatible with Mercurial 4.7 (Bug 1485874) r=gps

After applying the series, we are compatible with Mercurial
4.7 on this extension.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6739

11.commit_message:
hgmo: send archives info to template layer in `repoinfo` webcommand (Bug 1485874) r=gps

The `repoinfo` HTML template needs the `archives` field to be
set to properly render the navbar on the page, yet we aren't
sending anything to the templater to display. Under Mercurial
4.7 this causes a 500 to be thrown, so let's send this now.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6738

12.commit_message:
hgmo: create bugs, reviewers, backouts fields with generators (Bug 1485874) r=gps

This lets us pass them to the template layer as a `mappinggenerator`
and brings us closer to 4.7 compatibility.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6737

13.commit_message:
hgmo: add `automationrelevance` JSON template (Bug 1485874) r=gps

This commit adds an `automationrelevance` template to the `json`
template, allowing us to send the output of the `automationrelevance`
webcommand through the template layer instead of streaming
JSON directly. Due to this change, output from the raw
HTTP endpoint is no longer nicely indented. We now send the
response to a body file and then use `json.tool` to format
the output.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6736

14.commit_message:
hgmo: remove unused variable (Bug 1485874) r=gps

Leftover from removing pre-4.6 compatibility code.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6735

15.commit_message:
hgmo: get context using `scmutil` functions (Bug 1485874) r=gps

We use the `repo[x]` syntax in several places throughout the
hgmo extension. Using that syntax for certain use cases is
no longer supported. The recommended methods to use are found
in the `scmutil` module.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6734

16.commit_message:
hgmo: wrap `csets` field as a `templateutil.mappinglist` (Bug 1485874) r=gps

I decided to just wrap the end list instead of making this a
generator as the command is legacy and it was faster.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6733

17.commit_message:
zookeeper: mirror systemd config in test suite (Bug 1492453); r=gps

In a previous commit we added GC logging to the Zookeeper processes
by setting environment variables in the systemd unit for those
processes. It slipped my mind that we don't use systemd in
docker, and need to update in a second location for parity in
the test suite. This commit should fix that issue.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6447

18.commit_message:
kafka: modify heap memory allocation config (Bug 1492453); r=gps

This commit adds the `KAFKA_HEAP_OPTS` environment variable to
the `kafka` systemd unit. Setting this variable will override
the default heap allocation settings from "-Xmx1G -Xms1G"
to "-Xmx512m". Essentially, this will do two things. First,
it lowers the maximum heap allocation pool from 1GB to
512MB. We are doing this in the hope that we can trigger
GC on the Kafka processes sooner than our current deployment,
which should make GC take less time as there will be less
stale memory to collect. Second, we are removing the
initial memory allocation setting altogether. This should force
Kafka to only use as much memory as it needs (it rarely requires
1GB, especially not at program startup) and should provide a small
performance boost in the test suite.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D6446

19.commit_message:
unifyrepo: remove call to `bm.clear()` (Bug 1485882) r=gps

In Mercurial 4.7, the `bmstore` class is no long a subclass
of dict, making the call to `clear()` invalid. We can achieve the
same result by setting the value of any keys we wish to delete to
`None`, under both 4.6 and 4.7.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D4696

The biggest change here is that the tart.html page that drives the
test (not to be confused with the pages loaded in new tabs during the
test) moves from a chrome: page inside the extension to a regular http:
page.  That also required revamping the communication between tart.html
and the extension.  The rest of the changes are just the packaging and
startup mechanics for the test extension.

Bug 1500064 - Use GCHashSet in property enumeration code. r=jonco

This changes Maybe<IdSet> to Rooted<IdSet>. I think the Maybe<>
is not buying us much because HashTable's storage is now lazily
allocated (bug 1481998). I didn't notice any regressions in
micro-benchmarks; this patch might be a small improvement actually.

17.commit_message:
Bug 1499209 - Refactor AccessibleWrap::ToBundle 1/2. r=Jamie

This refactor does a few things:
1. Unifies the composition of the GeckoBundle, so that some tricky edge
cases don't need to be implemented twice.
2. Allows us to be more frugal with round trip sync ipc calls. Instead
of retrieving everything from the start, only progressivley retrieve
what we need.
3. Sets the groundwork for the next patch that will return from this
function earlier with a smaller bundle.

Differential Revision: https://phabricator.services.mozilla.com/D8778

9.commit_message:
Bug 678322 - Follow-up: more tests including matching based on message string properties. r+a=jorgk

nsMsgSearchTerm::MatchArbitraryHeader() can do matching using message string
properties and by matching headers line by line.

test_search.js was only testing second case for duplicated headers. Now we also test
first case. Also added more tests for second case.

10.commit_message: Bug 678322 - Follow-up: fix logic error and cater for IMAP case where headers are not available. r+a=jorgk

11.commit_message:
Bug 678322 - process all duplicate headers when searching. r+a=jorgk

Search in all headers even if header with the same name occured multiple times.
Stop treating Received in special way as now it's not needed - we will search
all Received occurences (just like any other header) now.

Add tests for for the problem.

17.commit_message:
Bug 1499906 - Use String.prototype.padStart(). r=erahm

This lets us remove pad().

18.commit_message:
Bug 1499906 - Use toLocaleString(). r=erahm

This replaces a bunch of code that inserted separators by hand.

For now I've kept the output mostly the same by forcing the locale to en-US.
But at least now we could consider localizing the output.

The places where the output is different, it's more consistent with the new
code. E.g. printing "-05.55%" (which matches "05.55%") instead of "-5.55%".

19.commit_message:
Bug 1499906 - Change `var` to `let`. r=erahm

For consistency; `let` is used in most places.

5.commit_message:
Bug 1495245 - Refactor AudioDeviceMessageRunnable's use of the PluginModuleSet. r=jmathies, a=RyanVM

Changes AudioDeviceMessageRunnable to hold the AudioNotification instead of its PluginModuleSet to simplify object lifetime issues. AudioNotification is ref-counted so we can increment its ref-count during the asynchronous Runnable.

18.commit_message:
Bug 1469803 Separate bouncer-check for cron tests r=mtabara

We shouldn't run this on central, as it falls back to the dev configs, and fails.
It should be fine on beta/release/esr60. I had to move this version of the check to its own
kind to avoid the dependency tree bringing in the entire build process. Perhaps we can
refactor later to avoid duplication
